solution_line_template: Anna bought {num_gum_packs} packs of chewing gum that were ${gum_price} each for a total of {num_gum_packs}*{gum_price}=$<<{num_gum_packs}*{gum_price}={gum_total}>>{gum_total}

Anna bought {num_chocolate_bars} chocolate bars that were ${chocolate_price} each for a total of {num_chocolate_bars}*{chocolate_price}=$<<{num_chocolate_bars}*{chocolate_price}={chocolate_total}>>{chocolate_total}

Anna bought {num_candy_canes} large candy canes that were ${candy_cane_price} each for a total of {num_candy_canes}*{candy_cane_price} =$<<{num_candy_canes}*{candy_cane_price}={candy_cane_total}>>{candy_cane_total}
Anna had ${starting_money} to start and spent ${total_spent} so she had ${starting_money}-${total_spent} = $<<{starting_money}-{total_spent}={money_left}>>{money_left} left
